intro: Sparattanthelium tarapotanum, commonly known as the Tarapotanum grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, blade-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate climates and is often found in mountainous grasslands. Its flowers are small and clustered in panicles, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
